reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want tranquillity, style and absolutely magnificent views you will struggle to beat this Parador. Several miles up a mountain road and you see the Hotel. At this stage you appreciate the views, you will also I suspect need a car. The service was excellent; even though our air conditioning didn’t work every attempt was made to repair it then adequate compensation made without quibble. The surrounding countryside is magnificent, the views from the bar terrace and rooms over look the man made reservoir. Without prior knowledge I would have assumed it was a lake rather than a flooded valley, the church tower peeping out of the water should be a slight give away. The breakfast is first class with lots of variety and quality ingredients. We ate in the hotel restaurant the two evenings we were there rather than drive some miles to alternative restaurants. The food was typically Spanish, well presented but the English taste for vegetables unsatisfied. We intend to return later in the year and enjoy some of the well sign posted walks.
reviews.title: Super views
Relaxing and Nice
reviews.text: The hotel is located down a windy country road. It was perfect haveing just drove from the bustling city of Barcelona (which is a mere 45 minutes away). The view is lovely. The staff was courteous and helpful and the food good. The rooms are fairly basic, but clean. Be sure to take a short drive past the hotel up to the monestary, definately worth it.

We stayed here in June, 2003, and we loved the location. It is not the easiest place to find, as it is somewhat in the middle of the forrest, at the end of a narrow road. But the view from the place was fantastic, and it was extremely relaxing. We spent the time rading books and relaxing in the garden and on the balcony. The food was very good and the staff was nice, however we were somewhat disappointed that the pool was not open yet (in June!). The rooms are nice, but somewhat run down compared to other Paradores in the area, but I would strongly recommend going here if you want a relaxing time in the woods. The area should be good for tracking and outdoor sports too.
reviews.title: Lovely location, nice food and very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel did not meet my expectations...it exceeded them! Breathtaking view across valley (yes there are some parked cars in foreground) from a wonderful terrace (such comfortable seats) with canopy if too hot. Barman was great.
reviews.title: Wonderful, should be 5*

reviews.text: Nice swimming pool with plenty of loungers. Very spacious and light room/bathroom (and we had lowest level of room). Restaurant food very good. Stayed later in Pyrenees in 5* la Pleta hotel that in no way came up to these standards except for food.
reviews.title: The view was great, but not really 4 star

likes.disliked: — Our room location - right above the kitchen - room 101

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do visit the monastery via road just above (3.5km)
reviews.title: Away from it all

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Parador de Vic-Sau in Room 101. It was a room with a living room, but was right above the kitchen. It had a beautiful view, but was pretty loud and occasionally smelly. Our next Parador was at Cardona, and by comparison, Cardona was much nicer. The food was pretty good, but we'll skip Vic-Sau next time.
reviews.title: Exquisite Location; Beware the Dining Rooom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overlooking the Sau reservoir (which looks more like a natural lake), this hotel has fantastic views and an excellent restaurant. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a "get-away-from-it-all" break. - unless you are put off by the 6-mile drive from the main road (which I would claim to be an advantage rather than a problem). Located about 70 miles north of Barcelona, it's a great centre for exploring Catalonia. But you do need a car!
reviews.title: Serenity Now

likes.liked: — Peaceful, nature, cool small towns, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The setting and view are beautiful, and as far as we could tell, virtually every room has a view of the lake (really a reservoir, but it looks like a lake). The public areas are attractive, especialy the stained-glass celing in the entry area. Staff was courteous, but stiffly so. (Not unusual in Spain. They're doing their jobs, not being your best friend as seems to be the task of American hotel staff and restaurant servers.) Trade-offs: it's miles from anywhere else, our room was a bit cramped and shopworn, the hotel had a distinctly unpleasant "moldy" smell when we first arrived, and the "lake" can send a rotting vegegation smell into your room when the wind blows the wrong way. (We saw nothing to explain why that was happening. What you see is beautiful.) Also, the restaurant was ovepriced and subpar in quality. We've reluctantly concluded that "tasting menus" at the paradors are profit centers for them rather than culinary undertakings, and the food (and especially wine) prices are not supported by the quality. (Drive almost exactly 2 miles away from the parador (there's only one road), turn right toward Fussimanya, and stay on that road (1 -2 miles?) until you come to the local restaurant named Fussimanya (Spanish, not Asian). Wonderful food, friendly staff, great prices. English menus (sort of), but very little English spoken by the staff.) Despite the trade-offs, we enjoyed our stay and recommend the parador.
reviews.title: Wonderful, but with trade-offs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The web site photos for this parador do not lie. The impressive photos were exactly what we saw when we arrived. The windows in our room opened to this stunning view as well -- even in the bathroom! The late afternoon sun and a gentle breeze were heavenly. After a day of site seeing, it is a great place to retreat to and relax. The hotel restaurant is pricey but the food is very good. We opted for the "regional tasting" menu and enjoyed every bite. We booked directly on their web site and got a very good deal on the room. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Spectacular view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anywhere you go in Spain, if a Parador is one of your options, it's often the best one. This Parador is in the middle of nowhere, but that's fine -- on top of a mountain overlooking a beautiful lake and the surrounding countryside. Very few options for dinner, since there are no towns close by, but that's okay because the restaurant is quite good, and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Middle of Nowhere, and That's Fine

reviews.text: A very nice facility with beautiful views of a reservoir (which looks like a natural lake) surrounded by rocky hills. We were upgraded to rooms with reservoir views. (We paid 130 euros for double with 55+ discount; 90 euros for single with under 25 discount; including excellent buffet breakfast.) Nice swimming pool, though water was cool. A good relaxing break from urban siteseeing. We thought the restaurant was good, though fairly expensive. In the evening we had delicious ham and cheese platters from the bar on outdoor seats overlooking the reservoir.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and setting

reviews.text: This Parador is nice, quiet and in a lovely location overlooking a mountain lake. As every Parador the personnel is employed by the state and they do behave like civil servants, so do not expect too much... The rooms are spacious and clean. To my opinion it is worth paying a little bit more to get one of the rooms with a big balcony overlooking the lake. The restaurant is not bad for one night, but the menu is very limited, so if you stay several nights it will always be the same. One tip is to prefer FUSSIMANYA - Ctra. Vic-Parador Nacional, KM 7. TAVERNOLES BARCELONA
reviews.title: GREAT, BUT...

reviews.text: We stopped off at the Parador in Vic Sau for one night en route from Spain to France. It appeared that most of the other residents were there fror the same reason.
reviews.title: A goos stopover near the border

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After the heat of the Costas, the location of the Parador makes for a refreshing and restful change. The road up from Vic winds through forest and is a gentle introduction to a greener Spain. The Parador itself is a practical conversion of a traditional building, retaining its exterior character, but with a spacious, light and cool interior. The reception area is spacious and light, and the reception staff are first class. The rooms are also light and spacious, with particularly fine bathrooms, which is a strongpoint of Paradors. Our room was restricted to an outlook over the Hotel yard and car park, but for a one night stay, this didn't concern us greatly. By contrast, the views from the fron of the Parador are spectacular, looking over the Hotel garden and swimming pool and across the reservoir in a flooded valley. The peace and tranquility of the place are particularly welcome after a long drive. Whilst the remoteness of the location offers such splendid vistas and peace, it means that other than a lengthy drive into Vic, the choice of dining is limited to the Hotel. As with most Paradors, the menu is a triumph of presentation over substance, and is expensive to boot. Service is indifferent, and the barman really does need a few lessons in how to deal with his clients.
reviews.title: Away from it all with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The day of our departure was brilliantly clear and sunny which provided us with a spectacular journey across the Pyrenees into France. This was why we had chosen Vic Sau, and the trip fully justified the decision. It is very easily accessible from the motorway, and with a relatively easy and extremely pretty journey across the top and into France.
reviews.title: lovely hotel in equisite natural surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We syated here for 3 nights after 3 days in Barcelona. It was wondeful to have the peace after the heat and bustle of Barcelona. We drove up via Montserrat - you definately need a car. The lobby is great and airy with a wonderful staned glass ceiling - a Gaudi influence here! Had booked the lowest level of room but couldn't had wished for better - large light airy with the most glorious view over the lake! Didn't have a balcony but there is such a good terrace didn't need one. The pool was great for chilling, plenty of loungers and shade if needed. Glad we took some walking shoes since the walk along the trail to the monestary was wonderful - full of dramatic river and lake views - and the monestary itself was well restored. There are plenty of other walking trails around. Do go to Rupit - it is very old and cute - but also take the walking trail to the waterfall. In August it is a 'lack of water' fall, but still dramatic to see the river end at a 100m (300 ft) cliff face - must be truely drammatic in spring/early summer. The dining room is a bit antiseptic looking/feeling but the food, although not cheap, was up to the usual excellent Parador standard. A great antedote to Barcelona but 3 nights long enough.
reviews.title: Peaceful parador

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night on our way home from Lleida. We chose it because we have generally found Parador hotels to be good and we wanted somewhere tranquil in the mountains. On arrival, the young man at reception, having noted from the reservation that my husband had recently had a serious operation, immediately asked to take our luggage up to our room which was on the 2nd floor overlooking a beautiful lake - all the rooms have a similar view. Happily they have non smoking rooms, which not all hotels in Spain can provide. The room was comfortable with a good bathroom & a lovely terrace onto the lake. The bar is cool & no-smoking too, as is the restaurant! One can, of course, smoke at the outside tables. The service was very professional and pleasant. We had a very good evening meal. You can count on about 35€ a head if you have 2-3 courses. The hotel is actually located 15 kms from the town of Vic, so you would need a car to access it easily & you would also have to consider whether you want to enjoy the restaurants of Vic itself in the evening as it is a 30 km round-trip. However, the beauty of the surroundings and the excellent services in the hotel are enough to stay put for a night or 2. There is an interesting 11C monestary a short drive away to discover, perched on a cliff overlooking the lake.
reviews.title: Lovely location

likes.disliked: — Darkness and lack of view from rooms at back
